bibl.title: Ben cao gang mu dictionary Vol1

sense.def: ①The season of summer. Zhu bing yuan hou lun 諸病源候論 23: 人盛暑之時，觸冒大熱，熱毒氣入臟 腑 , “When during mid summer a person is affected by the malicious in the form of massive heat, and the poison qi of heat enters the depots and palaces”.

② Alternative Names shu qi 暑氣 , qi of summerheat. Summerheat. Climatic Condition of burning heat. Su wen 素問 5: 喜怒不節 , 寒暑過度 , 生乃不固 , “If joy and anger are unrestrained, if cold and summerheat exceed the norms, life no longer exists on a solid [foundation]. ③ Alternative Names shu qi 暑氣 , qi of summerheat; shu re 暑熱 , summerheat; shu ye 暑暍 , summerheat. Etiological Agent. of heat qi during summer causing harm to man. Su wen 素問 3: 因於 暑 , 汗 , 煩則喘喝 , 靜則多言 , 體若燔炭 , 汗出而散 , “As a result of summerheat and sweat, if [the patient suffers from] uneasiness, he will pant with much noise; if he is at peace, he [nevertheless] speaks a lot. The body resembles burning coal. Flowing sweat makes [the internal heat] disperse”. ④ Alternative Names shu bing 暑病 , summerheat disease. Pathological Condition brought forth either by the qi of summerheat, or a cold affliction in winter caused by summerheat. Su wen 素問 31: “ 後 夏至日者為病暑 , “Those cases following summer solstice day, they constitute a suffering from summerheat ”. Ben cao gang mu 本草綱目 百病主治藥 distinguishes between 受暑 中暍 , “Affection by heat during summer”, and 受涼中暑 , “Affection by summerheat during a cool period”. However, in its main text, there is no strict division between 中暍 , struck by heat, and 中暑 , struck by summerheat. Ben cao gang mu 本草綱目 lists the following as shu bing 暑病 , “summerheat disease”: zhong shu 中暑 , struck by summerheat; fu shu 伏暑 , hidden summerheat; shang shu 傷暑 , harm caused by summerheat; mao shu 冒暑 , malicious summerheat; shu shi 暑濕 , summerheat with moisture; shu feng 暑風 , summerheat with wind; shu xie 暑瀉 , summerheat outflow; shu du 暑毒 , summerheat poison.
